alert.note: Alert for Hampden; Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:22PM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Massachusetts... Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hartford and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampden and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. For the Connecticut River...including Holyoke, Middle Haddam, Montague, Holyoke Dam, Northampton, Hartford, Thompsonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Northampton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding affects a large portion of the Oxbow in Northampton. Flood waters also reach Route 5, a portion of which may be impassable. Flooding spreads across the lower lying sections of Hadley. In Hatfield, back water from the Connecticut River will push the Mill River over its banks, flooding parts of Valley Street and surrounding areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 114.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 112.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 PM EDT Tuesday was 114.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 114.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 112.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 114.9 feet on 07/02/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 630 AM EDT.
